item.description:
Participate in building a sukkah, the temporary outdoor dwelling used during the holiday of Sukkot. Use this opportunity to prune your trees and bushes, and bring the branches to be used for the roof. (Prunings 1½ to 2 ft are the ideal size.) If you have decorations (or materials to make some), they would be welcome also. No tools are necessary, but bring your own work/garden gloves if you have them.
RSVP: REQUIRED to the Event Coordinator, Anne, are.catwoman@verizon.net
MEET: At Noontime. Address and directions will be sent to those who RSVP.
COST: Free, even to non-members. I’ll even provide beverages and pastry. That’s better than free, right?

Plans for the use of the Sukkah to celebrate Sukkot will be coming shortly
item.how_to_find_us: Conact Anne through an RSVP and she can give you the details and directions

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: Build A Sukkah
